memberdef.argsstring: (wxWindow *parent, const wxWindowID id=wxID_ANY, const wxString &dir=wxDirDialogDefaultFolderStr, const wxPoint &pos=wxDefaultPosition, const wxSize &size=wxDefaultSize, long style=wxDIRCTRL_3D_INTERNAL, const wxString &filter=wxEmptyString, int defaultFilter=0, const wxString &name=wxTreeCtrlNameStr)
memberdef.name: wxGenericDirCtrl

parameterdescription.para: Window style. Please see wxGenericDirCtrl for a list of possible styles.
A filter string, using the same syntax as that for wxFileDialog. This may be empty if filters are not being used. Example: "All files (*.*)|*.*|JPEG files (*.jpg)|*.jpg"

memberdef.argsstring: (wxWindow *parent, const wxWindowID id=wxID_ANY, const wxString &dir=wxDirDialogDefaultFolderStr, const wxPoint &pos=wxDefaultPosition, const wxSize &size=wxDefaultSize, long style=wxDIRCTRL_3D_INTERNAL, const wxString &filter=wxEmptyString, int defaultFilter=0, const wxString &name=wxTreeCtrlNameStr)
memberdef.name: Create

briefdescription.para: Tries to expand as much of the given path as possible, so that the filename or directory is visible in the tree control.
Gets selected filename path only (else empty string).

detaileddescription.para: This function doesn't count a directory as a selection.

briefdescription.para: Fills the array paths with the currently selected filepaths.

detaileddescription.para: This function doesn't count a directory as a selection.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the filter list control (if present).
Gets the currently-selected directory or filename.
Gets the path corresponding to the given tree control item.
Fills the array paths with the selected directories and filenames.
Returns the root id for the tree control.
Returns a pointer to the tree control.
Collapse and expand the tree, thus re-creating it from scratch.

detaileddescription.para: May be used to update the displayed directory content.

parameterdescription.para: If true, hidden folders and files will be displayed by the control. If false, they will not be displayed.

detaileddescription.para: In multiple selection controls, can be also used to deselect a currently selected item if the value of select is false. Existing selections are not changed. Only visible items can be (de)selected, otherwise use ExpandPath().

briefdescription.para: Selects only the specified paths, clearing any previous selection.

detaileddescription.para: Only supported when wxDIRCTRL_MULTIPLE is set.

briefdescription.para: Removes the selection from all currently selected items.
This control can be used to place a directory listing (with optional files) on an arbitrary window.

detaileddescription.para: The control contains a wxTreeCtrl window representing the directory hierarchy, and optionally, a wxChoice window containing a list of filters.
This class supports the following styles:

wxDIRCTRL_DIR_ONLY: Only show directories, and not files.
wxDIRCTRL_3D_INTERNAL: Use 3D borders for internal controls.
wxDIRCTRL_SELECT_FIRST: When setting the default path, select the first file in the directory.
wxDIRCTRL_SHOW_FILTERS: Show the drop-down filter list.
wxDIRCTRL_EDIT_LABELS: Allow the folder and file labels to be editable.
wxDIRCTRL_MULTIPLE: Allows multiple files and folders to be selected.

wxOSX Appearance
Event macros for events emitted by this class:

listitem.para: EVT_DIRCTRL_SELECTIONCHANGED(id, func): Selected directory has changed. Processes a wxEVT_DIRCTRL_SELECTIONCHANGED event type. Notice that this event is generated even for the changes done by the program itself and not only those done by the user. Available since wxWidgets 2.9.5.
EVT_DIRCTRL_FILEACTIVATED(id, func): The user activated a file by double-clicking or pressing Enter. Available since wxWidgets 2.9.5.
